content.description: Strange black colored blade of rock jutting out of the right edge of the boulder. Climb the clean overhanging face with large crimps separated by big reaches to an easy topout. Left wall & arete are off.The starting jug and crux side pull are loose with upward pressure, but remain solid under natural climbing forces.Sit start & top out. Very clean / flat landing.
content.location: GPS Coordinates: 39.3425° N, 77.6745° WAbout 0.4 miles past the overlook heading North along the Appalachian Trail. Visible from trail about 40 feet away out left (if heading North). Just before the apex of the hill, & past some smaller boulder outcroppings also on the left.

content.description:
Small cliff band overlooking Potomac River with boulders in surrounding area. Mostly undocumented other than the few climbs at the overlook. Expect overgrowth and steep terrain at the base. Most of the surrounding rock is choss, but the occasional solid boulder can be found with some exploration.. 

  The hike up to the overlook is extremely popular (as is with all AT parking lots) and will be very crowded on weekends.
